Based on your preference cues for movies that surprise you emotionally, I would recommend "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain.
This classic novel tells the story of a young boy named Tom who lives in a small town with his older sister Sally. One day, Tom discovers a mysterious treasure map hidden inside an old rusty lock box. Intrigued and determined to find the treasure, Tom sets out on a journey filled with danger, adventure, and unexpected twists.

The characters in this novel are well-developed and engaging. Tom is a clever and resourceful young boy who has the ability to overcome even the most daunting challenges.
Sally is Tom's older sister who is kind and caring towards Tom and her family. Sally has the ability to help Tom and his family overcome even the most daunting challenges.
The setting in this novel is well-developed and engaging. The town where Tom lives is a small but quaint community that is filled with friendly and welcoming people who are always willing to help Tom and his family overcome even the most daunting challenges.

Overall, "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain is an excellent choice for anyone who is looking for a classic novel that tells the story of a young boy named Tom who lives in a small town with his older sister Sally.
